content: Sure, I can definitely help you with that! Flemish stew, also known as "stoofvlees" in Flemish, is a traditional Belgian dish made with beef, onions, and Belgian beer. Other common ingredients include beef broth, dark brown sugar, vinegar, and spices such as thyme, bay leaves, and cloves. Some variations may also include bacon or prunes. The stew is typically cooked slowly over low heat to allow the flavors to develop and the beef to become tender. It's often served with fries or mashed potatoes and is a hearty and comforting dish that is popular in Belgium.
